else if($mode ="google") then
»Edit Google-Charters
Task "Google"
Within this task, you will have to edit Charters, which were digitalized by ©Google.
The Metadatas was extracted with help of the OCR-Detection made by Google.
This method wasn't so good in assigning all the correct categories. In particular the OCR had problems recognising the part of the text representing the date of the charter.
As most of the documents are written in Latin, google produced some weird textfragments.
Your Task is to correct the Date-Entries inside the charters and the texts of the transcription.
If possible, enter the place of issue as well.
Here you can see some possible cases:
Example one
tag:www.monasterium.net,2011:/mom/resource/image/google-charter
As you can see, the date ("Datumsangabe") was not set automatically to the date from the charter. So you have to pick the correct date out of the image ("19. April 1322") and enter it into the corresponding field.
Example two
tag:www.monasterium.net,2011:/mom/resource/image/google-translation
In this example, you see that the automatical OCR by Google was not able to identify most of the character or words.
Our task is to correct the transcription of the charter and enter it inside the "Transcription"-tab.
For additional instructions how to work within the editor, please have a look into the »Documentation linked above or in the »Tutorial on top of the page.
else if($mode ="date") then
»Edit Date-Charters
Task "Date"
Within this task, you will have to edit Charters where the date-entries are not set or set to a high value of "99999999"
Your Task is to correct the Date-Entries inside the charters.
If you can't read the date or the daterange, please skip the charter and work on the next one.
If possible, enter the place of issue as well.
Here you can see some possible cases:
Example one
tag:www.monasterium.net,2011:/mom/resource/image/date
As you can see, the date was not set automatically to the date from the charter. So you have to pick the correct date out of the image ("19. November 1292") and enter it into the corresponding field.
The placename in this case is "Neubrandenburg".
If there is an undefined value like "Um 1290", you can enter it inside the dateRange-Field. Please use the syntax, which is mentioned inside the Documentation.
For additional instructions how to work within the editor, please have a look into the »Documentation linked above or in the »Tutorial on top of the page.
else if($mode ="transcription") then
»Edit Transcription-Charters
Task "Transcription"
Within this task, you will have to edit Charters and enter the transcripted text of the charters into the corresponding field.
Some of the Charters are digitalized by Google, so that it is possible to read the text without any necessarily palaeographic background.
If you are not able read the charter, please skip the charter and work on the next one.
